topics.body:
Just an idea.

If you had the power of God, what would you do for a millennium?

+Rules are (despite being God, there are rules):+
1) No breaking or altering the rules.
2) No deleting someone from existence.
3) No altering the fundamental laws of physics.
4) No altering free will.
5) No killing someone on purpose.
6) No telling the world you're God.

"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5323e0426368723d5f960100#post_5323e0426368723d5f960100
Create a "universe" that is a computer simulation of all potential realities with all potential laws of physics with overseer programs to oversee simulations development and make sure shit doesn't hit the fan.  Basically make a computer universe mmo with a system of creating mmo npc heroes whenever shit hits the fan to make sure things run smoothly.


Oh by the way random side note: The theory that our universe is actually a simulation does hold a unnerving amount of water to it.

topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5324046c6368725aa3840100#post_5324046c6368725aa3840100
What is the deal with worth the weight?
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5324078d6368722c1ad20000#post_5324078d6368722c1ad20000
It's a pun; well technically in this case it's a pun on top of a pun.

Worth the weight is when people make fun of how long people have been waiting for half life 3 by equating it to gabe's weight.

My pun is making a joke off of that by saying that half life 3 is so worth the weight that it's total mass would be enough to not only halt the expansion of the universe, but reverse it until the entire universe suffered a "big crunch" in which the entire universe reverts back to a single point.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
